results.title: Apples and pears: the Australian story
results.brief_description: Focuses on the story of apple and pear production in Australia from fruitgrower to exporter, and is supplemented by a comprehensive teachers guide which provides an interesting approach to effective use of the video material - planning an advertising campaign.

results.title: Apple iPhone 3
results.brief_description: Smartphones like the Apple iPhone allow instantaneous recording and sharing of videos. Along with social media, they’ve helped establish and spread social and political movements, while filmmakers have also shot entire films on the portable devices.
results.description: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. Mobile camera phones like those found in the Apple iPhone allow users to capture the world around them and share videos instantly. Along with the advent of social media platforms like Facebook, Twitter and Instagram, the camera phone was an important development in digital connectivity and the spread of social movements like the Arab Spring, Occupy Wall Street and Black Lives Matter. It has also become a modern tool for moviemaking, with filmmakers like Steven Soderbergh, Sean Baker, Jay Alvarez, Park Chan-wook and Michel Gondry shooting whole feature films with mobile cameras.
description_for_label: The power to record, document, and film footage is now in everyone’s pocket. results.title: Apple aphis
results.creator_credit: Stephen Ackroyd, Shell Film Unit and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: Discusses briefly five of the most destructive of the family Aphididae which attack apple trees and fully illustrates the life-cycle of one of them, the green apple aphis. Using micro-photography techniques the various stages in the life-cycle are shown - from the emergence of the nymph from the egg through to mating and reproduction. A final diagrammatical section summarizes the life-cycle.

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Appearances can deceive: offenders with intellectual disabilities
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, Suzanne Baker Productions, New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Disability Services Co-ordination Unit, New South Wales Film Corporation and Bob Kingsbury
results.brief_description: Designed to improve awareness of intellectually disabled offenders in the criminal justice system, given that this group comprise a disproportionate percentage of both the prison population and juvenile offenders held in institutions. Re-enacts a shop lifting offence by an intellectually disabled youth and follows the case from initial apprehension by the store detective and police interviewing to the arrest and court proceedings. Emphasises the importance of liason with community agencies.
results.title_for_label: Appearances can deceive: offenders with intellectual disabilities

results.title: Appearance
results.brief_description: Few of us are happy about the way we look. We are either too short or too fat; our noses are too big or the wrong shape. As more people resort to surgery to alter appearance, this program talks to people about what they’ve done and the effect that it has had on their lives.
